steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. It's the red, yellow, green, and blue sphere icon.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This icon is in the top-right corner of the Chrome window. Clicking it will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select More tools.
steps.content: Select More tools . It's toward the bottom of the drop-down menu. Doing so prompts a pop-out menu.

steps.title: Click Extensions.
steps.content: Click Extensions . This option is in the pop-out menu. The Extensions page will open.

steps.title: Click the trash can icon.
steps.content: Click the trash can icon. It's to the right of the toolbar that you want to uninstall. You may first have to scroll down to the toolbar.

steps.title: Click Remove when prompted.
steps.content: Click Remove when prompted. Doing so will delete the extension from Google Chrome.

steps.title: Close and re-open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Close and re-open Google Chrome. When Chrome finishes loading after re-opening it, the toolbar should be gone.

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. It's a blue globe icon with an orange fox wrapped around it.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . It's in the top-right corner of the Firefox window. Doing so prompts a drop-down window.

steps.title: Click Add-ons.
steps.content: Click Add-ons . This puzzle piece-shaped icon is in the drop-down window.

steps.title: Click the Extensions tab.
steps.content: Click the Extensions tab. It's on the left side of the page (Windows) or at the top of the pop-up window (Mac). If you can't find the toolbar you want to remove here, look for it in the Plug-ins tab instead.

steps.title: Click Remove.
steps.content: Click Remove . It's to the right of the toolbar you want to remove. Doing so will immediately delete the toolbar from your Firefox browser. You may have to scroll down to locate the toolbar that you want to uninstall.

steps.title: Close and re-open Firefox.
steps.content: Close and re-open Firefox. Once Firefox finishes reloading, the toolbar should be gone.

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge. Its icon resembles a dark-blue "e".

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . It's in the top-right corner of the Edge window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Extensions.
steps.content: Click Extensions . This option is toward the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select the toolbar extension.
steps.content: Select the toolbar extension. Click the toolbar extension that you want to remove. A pop-up menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Remove.
steps.content: Click Remove . It's an option in the pop-up menu. Doing so will remove the toolbar from Edge. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Close and reopen Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Close and reopen Microsoft Edge. Once Edge finishes re-opening, the toolbar's interface will be gone.

steps.title: Open Internet Explorer.
steps.content: Open Internet Explorer. It's a light-blue "e" icon with a yellow band wrapped around it.

steps.title: Click Settings .
steps.content: Click Settings . This icon is in the top-right corner of the window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Manage add-ons.
steps.content: Click Manage add-ons . You'll find this option near the middle of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click the Toolbars and Extensions tab.
steps.content: Click the Toolbars and Extensions tab. It's on the left side of the Manage Add-Ons window.

steps.title: Select the toolbar extension.
steps.content: Select the toolbar extension. Click the toolbar that you want to remove from Internet Explorer. This will select it, bringing up contextual options in the bottom-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Remove or Disable.
steps.content: Click Remove or Disable . Depending on the type of toolbar (e.g., officially licensed by Microsoft), you may not be able to remove the toolbar entirely; however, you can disable it to turn it off. Third-party toolbars are entirely removable by clicking Remove .

steps.title: Close and re-open Internet Explorer.
steps.content: Close and re-open Internet Explorer. When Internet Explorer finishes re-opening, your toolbar should be gone.

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. This blue, compass-shaped app should be in your Mac's Dock at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Click Safari.
steps.content: Click Safari . It's a menu item in the top-left corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. If you don't see this menu item, click the Safari window to force it to appear.

steps.title: Click Preferences….
steps.content: Click Preferences… . It's at the top of the Safari drop-down menu. This will prompt a window to open.

steps.title: Click the Extensions tab.
steps.content: Click the Extensions tab. This option is toward the right side of the row of options at the top of the pop-up window.

steps.title: Click Uninstall next to the toolbar.
steps.content: Click Uninstall next to the toolbar. Make sure you do this next to the toolbar you want to remove. Doing so prompts a pop-up window.

steps.title: Click Uninstall when prompted.
steps.content: Click Uninstall when prompted. The toolbar will be removed from Safari.

steps.title: Close and re-open Safari.
steps.content: Close and re-open Safari. Once Safari reloads, the toolbar should be gone.
